name: Sequence - Robot programming simulator
description:
If you want to play a casual strategy game and have a good experience while it challenges you, "Sequence - Robot programming simulator" is perfect for you.

In this game you control a robot by programming him, that means writing a sequence of commands (following the rules you can find here or in the game) that makes sense.
If the sequence is well written, the robot will move, and if you reach the final panel of the level, you completed the level and pass to the next one.
Every level is different, with different form and different objets, and every level is always bigger than the previous one, being more difficult and needed of more commands to complete it.

You have 4 different types of robots, with different characteristics, that means there are 4 different paths (sequence of commands) for every level, corresponding with the 4 types of robots.


Commands:

-mu: move up
-mr: move right
-ml: move left
-md: move down
-u: use object placed on your localitation
-r3: repeat next command 3 times (could be another number)
-s1: use skill with number 1 ( could be another skill's number)

Rules:

-Commands must be separated with spaces. Example: ("mu r6 mr u r5 md..")

-Wrong commands will be ignored.

-The portal has to be reached only at 1 time (using only 1 sequence of commands)
